result.execSummary:
Adonis J Alvarez was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Adonis J Alvarez was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adonis J Alvarez

records.addlTxt: Paid Attorney Dailey Johnson for services on 6/15/22 through 6/21/22, batch 6350.
Copy of minutes from EH Hrg on 6/21/22 sent electronically to DCJ
of Remand

Defendant Adonis J Alvarez in court. Prosecuting Atty Paul W. Humphrey appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dailey Johnson in court for Defendant Adonis J Alvarez. Attorney Paul W. Humphrey in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Jim Larson sworn. Court speaks to previous cases.  Atty. Johnson: did discuss with his client today, did explain the Habeas corpus, and he is not going to contest this warrant.  ADA Humphrey: will be in custody about a week or less, state of LA is going to be coming to pick him up.  CT: was hoping to find a way to not have him sent back to LA while he has pending criminal cases in WI.  That doesn't seem to be an option as LA wants him back in that state. Court does have order for remand, and will sign that order.
Paid interpreter fees for services on 5/27/22 to Liesl Monroy, batch 6194.
from ADA Humphrey
Atty Dailey Johnson pursuant to CDP MOU, no reimbursement required.
Copy of minutes from EH Hrg on 6/14/22 sent electronically to DCJ
Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adonis J Alvarez in court. Prosecuting Atty Paul W. Humphrey appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul W. Humphrey in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Jim Larson sworn. Court speaks to case, SPD is still searching for an attorney for Mr. Alvarez.  ADA has also reached out to SPD, spoke with Atty. Dorl about trying to move him to the top of the list due to him being in custody solely on this case.  They have stated he is on the list, and has to wait.  Court is not allowed to set cash bail on this case, and he is entitled to have an attorney present for these hearing. The statue also instructs reasonable time to commence the action. Court is concerned about him remaining in custody. ADA Humphrey: the statue does not give time limits. He knows of cases in the extradition world, where it is generally a few days. Two things in conflict, needs a layer for Habeas corpus, or to address the warrant.  CT: what would happen if he waived it, not stating that he has or does. ADA: he would remain in custody under the warrant.  CT: would they take him back before the WI cases were resolved?  ADA: they would hold him on the warrant.  CT: asking ADA to reach out to LA, and find out if they would continue to hold him under the warrant even with the pending WI cases.  ADA: will contact LA, and write the Court.  CT: doesn't believe there is any legal grounds on us asking LA this, but with him being held solely on waiting for an attorney.  Court will set another status, to see if we have gained any ground. ADA: suggest if he has a family member locally or in LA to reach out to his probation agent down there, that may be helpful.  Mr. Alvarez: did speak to an attorney in LA, and he could work from there.  CT: that attorney would have to be licensed in the state of WI in order for that to work.  CT: if he has funds to retain an attorney privately here, that may help in this case. Mr. Alvarez: with not working, he doesn't have any funds.  CT: not able to let him out on bail on this case, the statue does not permit the Court to do so.  Mr. Alvarez: he would like to resolve his cases here, he states he paid a fine of $1,000 in LA.  Court adjourned.
Paid interpreter fees for services on 6/2/22 to Natalia Fajardo, batch 5984.
Extradition hearing on June 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant in court, in custody.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Natalia Fajardo, sworn.  Here for a continued extradition hearing today.  Mr. Alvarez still does not have counsel. Clerk did contact SPD to see if they could touch base with him, he had done so on his outstanding criminal cases, but not this case.  CT: asks if he did contact SPD.  He did speak with them on Tuesday, was told there is a long waiting list, so still does not have one appointed.  ADA: he does have a right to an attorney, but he also  has a right to Habeas Corpus.  Mr. Alvarez: would like to be let out of jail while he waits for an attorney.  ADA: cash bail doesn't apply now that the warrant has been served.  CT: a big conflict on his right to have an attorney and his right to resolve this matter.  He could be held for a long time just due to counsel. CT. not sure how to resolve that.  Court speaks to statue, ADA: bail was already set, and was refunded when the case was dismissed.  CT: believes that this case will need to be set over again, instructs ADA to contact LA and find out what they plan on doing, since he has two open cases in State of WI. CT: will set over again, new date and time given out.
Extradition hearing on June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Adonis J Alvarez in court. Prosecuting Atty Paul W. Humphrey appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul W. Humphrey in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Liesl Monroy appeared by telephone. Interpreter sworn.  ADA: was in court about a week ago, it was the 90 day deadline for Gov. warrant, as a result, State did motion the court to dismiss this case, which the Court did.  State moves to reopen case due to receiving the Gov. warrant, and order for remand.  Gov. warrant has now been served.  CT: currently he has outstanding cases in WI, should he be released back to that State if he has those open cases?  ADA: he would be able to remain in WI to resolve those cases, and once those are done, he could then go back to LA.  Court has colloquy with defendant on his rights, and his right to attorney.  He would like an attorney, has been calling SPD, but has been told they do not have one available at this time. CT: what is the next step that we need to take?  ADA: the Court is to give the defendant 48-72 hours to file a Habeas Corpus.  CT: he doesn't have an attorney  yet.  ADA: Maybe we can have a status, and Clerk will also contact SPD to see if they can get an attorney assigned.  Court does reopen case.  Notice of hearing given to defendant in court, so he has the information for SPD when they speak.
Governor's Warrant
of Remand

IN CUSTODY 

09:34 AM Defendant Adonis J Alvarez in court. Prosecuting Atty Paul W. Humphrey appeared for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter F. F., duly sworn. Defendant failed to previously appear at 4/19/22 Extradition Hearing.   State does not have gov warrant within 90 days, moving to dismiss. 

Case dismissed upon motion by the State.
